title: Time Delay Compensation and Stability Analysis of Networked Predictive Control Systems Based on Hammerstein Model

references.title: Adaptive Control of Systems with Actuator and Sensor Nonlinearities.
references.raw: Tao Gang and Kokotovic Petar V. Adaptive Control of Systems with Actuator and Sensor Nonlinearities. New York : Wiley, 1996.

references.title: Control methodologies in networked control systems.
references.raw: Yodyium Tipsuwan and Mo-Yuen Chow. Control methodologies in networked control systems. Control Engineering Practice, 11(10):1099– 1111, 2003.

references.title: Design and stability analysis of networked control systems with random communication time delay using the modiﬁed mpc.
references.raw: G.P.Liu, J. X. Mu, D. Rees, and S. C. Chai. Design and stability analysis of networked control systems with random communication time delay using the modiﬁed mpc. International Journal of Control, 79(4):288– 297, 2006.

references.title: Model Predictive Control.
references.raw: E.F Camacho and C. Bordons. Model Predictive Control. Springer, 2nd edition, 2004.

references.title: Nonlinear predictive control based on hammerstein models. Control Theory and Application,
references.raw: Zhu X F and Seborg D E. Nonlinear predictive control based on hammerstein models. Control Theory and Application, 11:564–575, 1994.

references.title: Packet-based control: The h2-optimal solution.
references.raw: Daniel Georgiev and Dawn M. Tilbury. Packet-based control: The h2-optimal solution. Automatica, 42(1):137–144, 2006.

references.title: Special issue on networked control systems.
references.raw: Antsaklis P. J. and J. Baillieul. Special issue on networked control systems. IEEE Trans. on Automatic Control, 49(9):1421–1597, 2004.

references.title: Stability analysis of generalized predictive control with input nonlinearity based on popov theorem.
references.raw: Ding Baocang, Li Shaoyuan, and Xi Yugeng. Stability analysis of generalized predictive control with input nonlinearity based on popov theorem. ACTA Automatica SINICA, 29:582–588, 2003.

references.title: Stability analysis of networked control systems.
references.raw: Gregory C. Walsh, Hong Ye, and Linda Bushnell. Stability analysis of networked control systems. In Proceedings of the 1999 American Control Conference, volume 4, pages 2876–2880, San Diego, CA., 1999.

references.title: Stability Analysis of Networked Control Systems.P h D thesis,
references.raw: Wei Zhang. Stability Analysis of Networked Control Systems.P h D thesis, Case Western Conserve University, 2001.

references.title: The design and analysis of constrained nonlinear control system based on hammerstein model. Control and Decision,
references.raw: Ding Baocang and Li Shaoyuan. The design and analysis of constrained nonlinear control system based on hammerstein model. Control and Decision, 2002.

abstract: A novel approach is proposed for a networked control system with random delays containing a nonlinear process based on a Hammerstein model. The method uses a time delay two step generalized predictive control (TDTSGPC), which consists of two parts, one is to deal with the input nonlinearity of the Hammerstein model and the other is to compensate the network induced delays in the networked control system. Theoretical results using the Popov theorem are presented for the closed-loop stability of the system in the case of a constant delay. Simulation examples illustrating the validity of the approach are presented
